oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cabinet card of Confederate veteran George C. Garrett and wife Nancy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. George Carroll Garrett (May 24, 1836-April 26, 1913) served in Co. E, 45th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. They farmed in Rutherford County (Tenn.) and are buried on this farm on Lamar Road. He enlisted in Murfreesboro in October 1862 and spent much of his enlistment in hospitals and at one point contracted measles. He was captured at McMinnville (Tenn.) in April 1863. He remained a prisoner until taking the Oath of Allegiance in April 1865.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Garrett, George C." Garrett, Nancy
